meanings.sent1: Her unbeliefs in magic made her skeptical of the magician's tricks.
meanings.sent2: His unbeliefs in ghosts led him to dismiss any spooky stories.
meanings.sent3: Despite her unbeliefs in fortune-telling, she jokingly asked the psychic for lottery numbers.
meanings.sent4: His unbeliefs in aliens were so strong, he refused to watch any sci-fi movies.
meanings.sent5: The child's unbeliefs in monsters made bedtime stories less scary.

meanings.definition: Refusal or rejection of belief or faith.
meanings.sent1: The cult leader's unbeliefs in traditional religions led to the creation of a new belief system.
meanings.sent2: Her unbeliefs in superstitions made her stand out in the small town.
meanings.sent3: His unbeliefs in the school's rules got him in trouble more than once.
meanings.sent4: The politician's unbeliefs in compromise made it difficult to reach agreements.
meanings.sent5: Their unbeliefs in authority figures made them question every decision.
